title: Configurable color schemes via config.json
description: Make Ralph's color output configurable. Add 'colorScheme' field to config.json with presets (default, dark, light, minimal, none). Each scheme defines colors for: success, error, warning, info, story types (US/V/BUG/TEST), models (opus/sonnet/haiku), costs. Users can also define custom schemes. Gracefully degrade if terminal doesn't support colors.

acceptanceCriteria.text: Add COLOR_SCHEMES associative array with preset schemes: default, dark, light, minimal, none
Scheme 'minimal' uses only essential colors (errors red, success green)
_ralph_init_colors() loads scheme colors into global RALPH_COLOR_* vars
Support custom scheme in config.json with explicit color codes
Auto-detect NO_COLOR env var and disable colors if set
Document available schemes in README or --help
